message.content:
In LibreOffice Calc, you can use the `SUBSTITUTE` function to remove all single quotes ('') from a string. If you want to copy the contents of one cell (let's say A1) and remove all single quotes from it, you can use an expression like this:

```excel
=SUBSTITUTE(A1,"'","")
```

This formula takes the content of cell A1 and replaces every occurrence of a single quote with nothing (effectively removing them). The result will be placed in the cell where this formula is entered.
